intro: Synema annuum, commonly known as the common synema, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Aizoaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, fleshy leaves that are typically covered in a fine layer of white or grayish hairs. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, often appearing in shades of yellow or orange. Synema annuum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
